holidays.name: World Environment Day 🌍
holidays.description: A day dedicated to encouraging worldwide awareness and action to protect our planet's environment.
holidays.origin: Established by the United Nations in 1974 to promote environmental consciousness globally.
holidays.funFact: Each year, World Environment Day is hosted by a different country, turning the spotlight on pressing environmental issues worldwide.

holidays.name: National Gingerbread Day 🍪
holidays.description: Celebrate the spicy, sweet goodness of gingerbread in all its forms – cookies, houses, men, and more!
holidays.origin: An American food holiday recognizing gingerbread’s long history in baking, dating back to Medieval Europe.
holidays.funFact: Did you know gingerbread originally was used as a form of medicinal bread? Some recipes include ingredients believed to have healing properties!

holidays.name: No Pants Day 🩳❌
holidays.description: A hilarious, unofficial holiday where people dare to go about their daily routines without pants, usually in colder climates!
holidays.origin: Started in the early 2000s as a quirky social experiment and spreading through viral internet challenges.
holidays.funFact: No Pants Day often involves public transit rides without pants, turning ordinary commutes into unexpected comedy shows.

holidays.name: National Moonshine Day 🥃
holidays.description: A toast to the outlaw spirit with a day to remember moonshine, the illegal but iconic homemade whiskey.
holidays.origin: Celebrated unofficially in the U.S. to honor the Prohibition era and the ingenuity of moonshiners.
holidays.funFact: Moonshine was often hidden in complex contraptions or even cars called 'bootleggers' to evade authorities during Prohibition!
